title: Patrice Bergeron was asked about possible 2026 Hall of Fame induction
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patrice Bergeron, retired Bruins captain, is eligible for the Hockey Hall of Fame induction class of 2026.
Bergeron, a 19-season NHL veteran, downplayed Hall of Fame speculation, expressing gratitude for his teammates' inductions.
Bergeron won the Selke Trophy six times and was a key player in Bruins' 2011 Stanley Cup win.

title: Boston police ask for help in search for missing 15-year-old
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police are searching for Briyana Jacques, a 15-year-old missing from Dorchester since Saturday.
She was last seen near Ashmont station and around 1300 Blue Hill Ave. on Saturday afternoon.
Jacques is described as 5'5", with brown hair, blonde highlights, a nose piercing, and wearing a black jacket.

title: Struggling military families ask Globe Santa for help
author: Linda Matchan
bullets: Military families in Massachusetts facing financial hardship turn to Globe Santa for holiday gift assistance.
High cost of living and government shutdown strain military families' finances, impacting their ability to afford essentials.
Globe Santa, a Boston Globe Foundation program, has supported children in need with holiday gifts for 70 years.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about Tuesday’s wind chill, potential for flurries
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: National Weather Service predicts unseasonably cold and windy conditions with potential brief flurries or snow showers, mainly in the Berkshires.
Meteorologist Cindy Fitzgibbon reports wind chills in the 20s on Veterans Day, with some sun and possible flurries.
Forecast indicates below-average temperatures continuing into the weekend, with a chance of a wintry mix on Sunday north of Route 2.

title: Love Letters notes on Veterans Day
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Meredith Goldstein's 'Love Letters' column is taking a break for Veterans Day.
An exclusive Globe event with author Elin Hilderbrand is upcoming; letters are needed for entry.
The latest 'Love Letters' podcast features a conversation with sports columnist Christopher L. Gasper.

title: After loss to Warren, Republican John Deaton announces another run for Senate
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: John Deaton announced a Senate run against Sen. Ed Markey at an event in Worcester.
Deaton previously ran against Sen. Elizabeth Warren, positioning himself as a moderate Republican.
Markey faces a primary challenge from Democrat Seth Moulton, with other potential candidates considering entering the race.

title: What will the Red Sox target this offseason? Craig Breslow maps out Boston’s priorities.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox chief baseball officer Craig Breslow prioritizes adding a top starting pitcher to support ace Garrett Crochet.
Boston may pursue trades for pitchers like Joe Ryan or target free agents such as Dylan Cease and Ranger Suarez.
Red Sox aim to enhance power in lineup, considering sluggers like Kyle Schwarber and Pete Alonso in free agency.

title: Zdeno Chara’s 10 most memorable moments with the Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Zdeno Chara captained the Boston Bruins for 14 seasons, leading them to a Stanley Cup win after 39 years.
Chara was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in 2025, recognized for his dominance as a defenseman.
Chara set the NHL record for hardest shot at 108.8 mph during the 2012 All-Star Game's skills competition.

title: Bill Belichick reflects on ‘learning curve’ during first season coaching college football
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Bill Belichick discusses the coaching challenges faced in his first season with the North Carolina Tar Heels.
UNC stands at 4-5 and ranks tenth in the ACC; they need two more wins to match last year's total.
Belichick reflects on player positioning and strategy adjustments as part of his learning curve in college football.

title: Patriots have 15 players land on injury report, but get some good news
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fifteen Patriots players, including Kayshon Boutte and Rhamondre Stevenson, appeared on Monday's injury report ahead of Thursday's game against the Jets.
Austin Hooper missed Monday's session with a concussion; Christian Barmore, Marcus Jones, and Jaylinn Hawkins were limited participants.
Despite injuries, Boutte and Stevenson practiced in a limited capacity, providing hope for their return against the Jets.
